title: Football Manager 2020
review:
Football Manager 2020 (FM20) is a football management game developed by Sports Interactive and published by SEGA. It was released on 19 November 2019. In this review, I will briefly cover Football Manager game play, run through the features introduced in FM20 and provide a perspective on the state of the game.

In FM20, you, the player, manage a football team through 118 playable leagues. Of this 118, 26 leagues in 14 countries are fully licensed and another 24 teams (national and domestic teams) are licensed. Within the 26 leagues: French Ligue 1 and Ligue 2, German leagues one to three, and English leagues two to four are fully licensed. The English Premier League, Spanish La Liga, and Italian leagues are not; though the Serie A has 18 of 20 licensed teams.

[h1] [b] Game Mechanics / FM20 Features [/b] [/h1]
Football Manager incorporates a variety of features and mechanics; including, but not limited to, 2D and 3D football matches, squad training, scouting and transfers, tactics, and financial management. The series also includes a vibrant modding community. In FM20, SI various smaller features such as Club Vision - long-term club progression, the introduction of the Development Centre, transfer negotiation improvements, better integration of backroom staff into your operations, and match engine and graphic upgrades.

I reflect on these main marketed features as small, but solid quality of life features that has a ton of room for improvement in future iterations. Club Vision enables you to consider the long-term aspect of the game, however I found that negotiating a different vision is not user-friendly to do and the Board of Directors offers you little flexibility to amend their vision. Further, Club Vision allows for player negotiations to be interesting by offering players different playing times, but a mechanic that SI should balance because the penalty for not adhering to the playing time is little.

More on FM20's features: The Development Centre is a cool feature that consolidates your developmental squads into a single UI. This is a neat addition because you can treat your reserve squads similarly, and staff provide useful contextual advice to you on the progression of players. The changes to backroom staff are visible, i.e. you can select Technical Directors and Loan Managers, but I have yet to see any observations in their role. Lastly, the match engine and graphic upgrades are nice, but the match engine has a lot of room for improvement. If I summarise FM20 by the above features is relevant, yet underwhelming, but nice inclusions to expand on the core game mechanics.

[h1] [b] Perspective on Annual Releases [/b] [/h1]
I have played Football Manager since Football Manager 2017. Across these four iterations, I recall that only two of the four (2017 and 2019) made substantial changes to the game. It appears that SI Games has a formula which Year X incorporates large changes and Year Y focusses on quality of life improvements that expand or address concerns on features from Year X.
 
I acknowledge the concerns of the community and question the situation: Is SI Games complacent? I think the football management market has a lack of competition and variety. While SI Games makes enjoyable annual games, I think they could address more community concerns, particularly with the match engine and to fix the various glitches and bugs throughout the game. I do appreciate that SI Games is expanding the licensing of official teams and leagues because it makes playing the game a more enjoyable experience. But in saying that, I vastly enjoy the Football Manager series and it is addictive; though sometimes a frustrating experience.

[h1] [b] Conclusion [/b] [/h1]
FM20 is an ultimately enjoyable game. It benefits from having a strong foundation of team management and football simulation, at the consequence of visible stagnation to new features and post-launch support. FM20 specifically, has some nice features, but I applaud more the many quality of life changes implemented by SI Games. If you are new to Football Manager, I recommend FM20 at full price. If you own FM19, I recommend the game on sale.

[h1] [b] Rating [/b] [/h1]
7.5/10

[h1] [b] Pros [/b] [/h1]
* Core mechanics are immensely fun, including team and financial management, and social feeds
* Development Centre is interesting and useful
* Modest match engine and graphical improvements, including upgrades to manager appearances
* Slightly improved press conferences and tunnel interviews; your manual comments can slightly benefit or hinder player morale.

[h1] [b] Cons [/b] [/h1]
* Series has a need for material improvement including: more animations and enhancing the fluidity of matches, more applicable feedback from players and staff, press conferences, and financial management such as customising and managing club facilities and managing tickets/negotiating sponsorship deals
* Underwhelming Club Vision and player negotiation features
* Inability to identify applicability of new backroom staff and the supposed improvements to staff.

If you found this review helpful, please give it a thumbs up. If you would also like to follow my reviews more easily, be sure to join my group http://steamcommunity.com/groups/AntwogReviews

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1100600/Football_Manager_2020/

title: Football Manager 2020

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
Dear FM20,

I'm leaving you......it's not you it's me, no actually it is you!!!! You've let yourself go, taken me for granted and so we need a break....I may see other people, just saying.

That's actually hard for me to say because I love the franchise. Like my wife, kids, dogs, summer holidays, American Truck, FM is embedded in to my daily life, it's amongst the things I value, adds balance to my life, or at least it did.

Honestly, the gameplay is simply the best it's ever been, albeit a little buggy in places. There is a but though and its a huge one.

The Match Engine is currently a disaster, easily the worst its ever been. I've played this game since inception, half of my life, I've never been as down on the ME as I currently am. Sure I can win games, win the league etc etc but I want and need it to resemble real football. 

At the moment the game is closer than ever to resembling real football off the pitch yet nothing like it on the pitch. Don't buy until these issues are resolved. If indeed that ever happens.

title: Football Manager 2020
review: Complete waste of money. Games that are hard and challenging are fun. However, FM 2020 has a clearly rigged engine. It's simple not realistic (nor fun) having 20 shots and not score once, while the AI has nearly 100% accuracy. You can literally lose a plethora of games just because the other team had 1 chance during the game! So, all those hours spent recruiting players, setting up tactics, pieces, researching, even watching YT videos...are worthless. The AI can win even it just had 1 GK and 1 Striker player vs 11. Don't buy this garbage.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
Quite simply put, not worth full price because the match engine is absolutely pathetic. The players stats do not matter and every goal keeper is the best goal keeper in the world. Also no matter how highly rated your strikers are, they will fail to convert 95% of chances. 

I'd say, either wait for SI to fix this sad excuse of an engine which is surprisingly worse than FM19 or wait for the game to be on a very deep sale, probably 95% off.

Update: Tried the latest beta patch, still the engine is broken. The players attributes are still not taken into consideration. Though 1v1 have reduced by around 90%, the strikers of your own team have completely forgotten how to play the game. The wingers have learned how to cross the ball and are more effective now. The defense how ever is still dumb struck over long balls over the head and overall haven't learned how to do their job, which is defending, instead they just turn around in circles and watch the opponents go past them. The cards have certainly reduced, but the foul count is still the same which is a lame way to fix an issue. The tactics and instructions are still a foreign language to the engine because it still calculates the winning chances based purely on the reputation of the club, which again is plain stupid. 
Advice to SI: Sack your current producer and don't release the next FM unless you fix the most important part of the game.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
The small amount of new features for each year of the series of Football Manager are for some or most dedicated fans more than enough to pay full price each year. Each year SI Games tweaks the game a bit to the better, sometimes with bugs and other new issues that comes along with that. A lot of players almost always ask for a new match-engine that will make the game more realistic. 
Ive bought this game(series) since before it was called Football Manager but the last year each time felt Im being robbed a bit, as some stuff that comes each year with a "Brand NEW IMPROVED game" should be updates or patches or even DLCs. 
The game is still in BETA you say, dont complain!!, but I wonder if the game ever does come out as it feels like an updated version each year. 
Im not voting down the game but more Miles Jacobsson and SI Games and how they take advantage of being the best of the football manager game series out there. 
And really, 3d animations? Does every damn player fall head over heels forward when they loose possesion? Give it some varation ffs Si Games

title: Football Manager 2020
review: I have to say I was really enjoying this years instalment of the franchise until they brought out the "match engine fix" patch which took the game from having to be tactically smart and choosing your transfers carefully to "He shoots, he scores". Goalkeepers have gone back to previous games of being redundant (one of the things I liked about this game was that goalkeepers actually made saves, sometimes even when one on one, now they are beaten every time) defending is poor and the whole premise is just who scores the most goals in the game (I know that's how you win games but winning games 5-4, 6-3, 4-3 isn't a good thing, especially as both teams hit the post so often despite how many goals are scored) I've tried different tactics and different teams to see if there are ways to not concede so many goals but there isn't, so just set out an attacking formation and hope you score more than your opponent, the whole thing is luck based now,  if your players are on form that day, you win, if not, you lose heavily and your teams morale is ruined. Such a shame as I would have heavily recommended this game before the update ruined the match engine, It's not a management game anymore, it's just a luck based simulator

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
EDIT:

Finally in a normal playable state as of feb 2020. Only took them 3 months after initial release. Exactly like the year before.

This years match engine is full of potential, but not quite there yet. However, thanks to the patch, most annoyances are done and gone. While not as "fun" as the "all out attacking ME" from last year, this year the ME is more mature and more subtle. More player roles actually play differently and directly influence the gameplay on the field. 

Finally I can recommend the game for anyone, even those that stayed with FM19 until now. FM20 is, thanks to the new patch, and better all-round football experience than FM19.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
I really wanted to like the game... I have been playing FM on and off since 2014, almost always managing my favourite club. After 2 very successful years with the confidence of the board being over 90%, I cannot play it anymore. The board is blocking my transfers cause they want me to sign more players from a specific country outside the EU. I already signed one last year who is now one of their top national team performers, I signed 3 promising youths who will be joining next year, they still block all my attempts to really strengthen the squad. I do not know how this is supposed to work... I do not know if the devs have understood how this works in reality but what they have implemented is totally crappy and a game stopper. Fun fact is that the specific team I am playing used to have two players from that country and now has none... Another issue I dealt with was the fact that the board was aiming at building a new stadium but when they agreed to upgrade the youth facilities this particular goal just disappeared and suddenly, even expanding the stadium was not deemed financially viable... Both these problems seriously affect my game and enjoyment and are by no means realistic.

Apart from that, I do not really understand how they can do that, but every year the game feels slower than last year. The match engine is not bad, but still far from being visually up to date, days drag by.. slowly... scouting feels much clunkier, training could use some automations and so on.

In all, I do sadly not consider FM2020 as a successful upgrade, I enjoyed FM2018 much more.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
The current status of the game is broken. (Feb 2020)
FM20 was good when released, but a patch december 3rd. contained a bug cluster preventing open play goals. Because of this, what you do as a manager have very little to no impact on what happen on the pitch. Strangly alot of people enjoy this since they can create almost any tactic and pretend they are tactical genious, since they all work about the same in all situations.
The Feb patch made som marginal improvment, but not nearly enough to fix the main issues.

If you have an older FM game I advice sticking to that for now, if you are ok with just buying the best players and win without the tactical or strategic part of the game I think you still enjoy it,

review: The game is fun and I recommend it. However, the game is extremely frustrating, as well. Amount of times you out-shot the opponent 33-2 and the game is 1-1 on a last minute tie goal is maddening. Do these type so games happen in real life...yes...but, that does not happen 10-15 times in a season to the same team...that might happen once every 5-10 years to a team. ME is horrible...try to ignore it. Gegenpress is OP.  Injury frequency seems to have no correlation to your physio team...maddening. But, after all that, a game that I love.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
So, I have played Football Manager for about twenty years, since the days it was still Championship Manager, back in 2000.
The game always had this random component to some aspects but it was fun once you got the hold of it and had your team playing in a consistent way. That is until this year.
It seems like the game is set to screw you most of the time. Really.
While this is not really something new to the avid Football Manager player, as most of us have experienced a sense of unfairness, at some point, in the game; on this version, you get it most if not all of the time.
Mind you that I am an experienced player and I have won, over the years that I have played the game, everything that there is to win and on different clubs.
On this year's version, despite winning the league on the first season and having a world class team, after three seasons, I couldn't even be a contender for the Champion's League qualification places. I had some of the best players in the game, like Tonali, Havertz, Ansu Fati, Sancho, Bernardo Silva. I had a dream team, really and I would struggle to beat weak teams. Constantly.
I tried multiple tactics, nothing really worked in a long therm. The tactic that won me the league, on the first year, suddenly stopped working even tho my team was actually stronger. I mean, you don't change something that is working and is consistent. Such is the philosophy that allowed me and, likely, most of the players in the game to achieve success, eventually. Even if there were some struggles at the beginning.
I tried to have more than one tactic and get my team familiar with those, so I could change if something was not working, I tried multiple approaches with training and team mentality, player instructions and, as stated, even with some of the best signings in the game, it wouldn't matter. AI would score goals, constantly, after being outplayed for the entire match. And yes, I know this happens in real life but it doesn't happens as often as in this game. It's stupid and unrealistic.
Maybe, for people who are really dedicated to the game, spend hours planning and reading every detail on the tactics and have a vast knowledge, these issues can be worked on but it's not really a game for the player who just wants to chill, keep things relatively simply and have some fun with their favourite team because, even the experienced player, might get screwed. 
The game can, indeed, be very gratifying when you win something, specially in the last games of the season, when everything is really close but, believe me, most of the time, it is incredibly frustrating. The possible reward by winning something, even with a top team, is not worth the annoyance and the sensation of wasted time and confusion as to why the AI still manages to beat you against all odds, more often than not.
I don't know what SI is doing but it seems like their attempt to make the game realistic has set them on a path where things are out of control, most of the time and you are always on the edge of your seat, on every game, regardless if you're playing against the strongest contender of the competition or a club that is just playing to avoid relegation. You never know if you're going to win, no matter how strong your team is.

It is pretty much what some people have been saying here, lately. You will also find many posts on Reddit about this.
No matter what you do, it won't make a difference and it is, probably, a bug from some recent update.

I liked the previous versions, on past years but I definitely do NOT recommend this game. Save your money, your time and, especially, your sanity.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
This game is a joke to the entire series.

So in the previous FM, when you figure it out how to outsmart the AI tactics and formation, you will score. Simple, right?

Not in this one baby 
The game is rigged, your 185 CA Striker (with high finishing and composure skill), will missed 9/10 times on 1 vs 1 against their 148 CA GK (with abysmal stat at "1 vs 1 skill" at all thing). And then their 158 CA Striker will score an unthinkable goal from 20 yards out of nowhere thrice a row!!! WTF?
So what you gonna do? Go back to square one and adjust your tactics, substitute, modify roles for your player? Good luck with that, it won't work, often it made you lose even bigger. Then i figure it out on the subreddit that they rigged it to made it more "challenge" instead of fixing the game's engine.

I wasted 13 hours of this mess just to figure it out that it was rigged. FML, now i can't even refund this.

It almost reminds you of FIFA or PES ten years ago when you can send through balls and 1-on-1 just by a click except your strikers (admittedly sometimes theirs) miss them in every way imaginable. That and many other disgusting plays you wouldn't see even once in a year irl...
I mean in previous FMs you feel like the game likes to screw you up once in a while but you understand it happens after a bit of anger. This FM2020? You feel like nothing makes sense and you constantly ask yourself what the fuq is wrong with the players.
Can't even count how many CM/FMs I've played and this is the first time I feel like a comment is needed. Sort this mess out please.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
Literally devastated.

Like so many others on here, I have played football manager religiously throughout my child and adulthood, and I have never seen any decline on quality of the releases year on year, but this year has been so disappointing.

The match engine is absolutely terrible. Every match regardless of the opposition you're up against or whichever tactic you employ, your opposition will have 10+ 1 on 1 opportunities in every single match. There is nothing you can do to counter it, and SI know all about it too but instead of fix the bug, they have lowered the conversion rate of the one on ones being finished. I have spent hours trying to tweak the tactics over the last 3 months but nothing works. 

They have ruined it. I am so desperate to continue my love affair with this game, but it is that bad this year that they may have lost me for good.

There is still time, they have just got to fix this one on one long ball bullshit.

review:
[ Not The Game We Wanted, But the Game We Deserved ]

To say the very least, FM20 showed tremendous potential with its novel features and other polished features from previous and other titles, Although what is still and may yet be perfect is its match engine that has its ups and down. I have played various playthrough and currently am half the season with Man Utd. Somehow the matches seems "Harder" and my form is destable compared to earlier part of the season. This occurs in other playthrough that I have played.

Talking about critics wise, I will mention several Cons that i felt should be mentioned

-Five star rated players that plays like a kid

-Had a time where the stadium had no supporters --> tried restarting but still didnt show any supporters

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
Despite some good aspects, I can't recommend this game.

The match engine is really, really bad. World class strikers almost always miss 1-on-1s. Defenders are horrible at positioning, and let strikers get 1-on-1s all the time - but it doesn't matter, because the strikers surely miss. There is zero reason to play in a counterattacking style in this game. 

Everyone in the goal area (defenders and attackers alike) look like Bambi on ice, and goalkeepers and defenders look tremendously stupid when they try to clear the ball, but accidentally shoot it into their own net. 

I like most aspects of this game *outside* of the matches, especially the people management aspects. But the good parts are completely overshadowed by the bad parts. Stay away from Football Manager 2020, and consider getting Football Manager 2008 instead.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
Have never written any reviews before, but this game is atrocious. Far worse than the previous iteration, FM 2019. 

They tinkered with the match engine and it is now an unreliable joke of a simulator with, among other things, an unrealistically high number of one-on-one opportunities.  In poor fashion, they reacted to this by making strikers terrible at finishing the said one-on-ones off. This is absolute bull. (estimate average of about maybe 5-8 a game, often with NONE of them finished off)

I got the game a while back, and refunded it after a day or so. I got it a second time against my better judgment and am here writing this after finishing 1 and a 1/2 seasons proper of the game to properly conclude that this game is absolute garbage. I say that knowing how hard some of the developers might have worked and how difficult a project such as this is. However, if it is significantly worse than the previous iteration, then I am fine with being overly harsh in this manner.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
I used to buy this game every year from back in the 90's when it was called Championship Manager, with the last FM I bought back in 2014 as the match engine was simply broken. I swore I was done buying the game but relented after 6 years and bought FM 2020. 
What a mistake. The match engine for fm2020 is even worse than in 2014, how is that even possible? 
Only one of the many tactical styles of play will ever get you results. You can spend hours setting team and individual tactics just to watch the game show your team following none of them. Constant direct long balls when playing possession build up is a joke, full backs scoring blinders every game while strikers can never convert the way too many 1v1 chances magically created. Defenders that do not play a covering role even when set to with a low defensive line are constantly going high just to then get beaten by a long ball to the striker in behind. It is clear the match engine is not an actual real-life game in motion, but pre-defined scripted plays that you have no control over, nor do your tactics.
This game is sold as being as close to real life as a football management game can be, funny how in real life I don't see every team playing route 1 long balls or the gegenpress across the world. 
Six years in between purchases was clearly not long enough...

title: Football Manager 2020
review: Best football game about

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
UPDATE: New BETA match engine, same old guff.
Now your full backs have lost the gift of sight, as they literally watch crosses, passes and players go past them without actually moving or even sticking a leg out.
Anticipation is 0. Literally 0. The ball will bounce off a post and NOBODY will move for it. Everybody, opposition included, now seem to ball watch.
Tactics still have no effect. Disciplined, positive, short passing football- so where does my advanced forward pass it? BACK TO THE CENTRE BACK! Who is marked. Who then falls over his own feet for no reason (maybe how the ME represents balance?)
Direct wing play? Game goes full back to winger, to full back, to winger- then out for a throw. F***ING CROSS IT YOU PLEBS!
I dream of a match that even remotely represents life. Where my defenders move with urgency, where COMMON SENSE exists and passes aren't completely idiotic. Oh well, maybe next year (I won't be buying it).

The game engine was broken on release:
*Strikers that can't score from inside the 6 yard box
*Wing backs who don't/won't CROSS or CUT BACK
*Idiot goalkeepers who use their knees instead of their hands
*Defenders who turn like a pint of milk and run the ball out of play/into their own net instead of turning sharply with urgency
*Players turning onto their weak foot and misplacing passes instead of their good foot- not even under pressure.
*EVERY. SINGLE. LONGSHOT. FROM 25 YARDS. FROM A PLAYER WITH 5 FINISHING. AND 5 TECHNIQUE. IN THE LOWEST LEAGUE. WILL SLAM INTO THE TOP CORNER. EVERY TIME. But a half volley from 6 yards central to the goal? Wide mate.
It's just not fun, not realistic, not a fair representation of professional players. YET if you ask an SI developer on Twitter, they defend it to the death. I've had a player miss NINE clear cut chances in one game, with 13 finishing, in the National League.
I've had a defender pick up the ball on his own 6 yard line, run behind the goalie and try to clear the ball, kicking it off the goalie and INTO HIS OWN NET. What's the tactical instruction for that one then? COMMON SENSE AND EYES?

Sort it out SI, your game's a joke.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
Unlike previous years, the engine is fucked. Tactics matter very little and there's very little diversity to what you can play with any element of success. The opposition get in behind every five minutes and no tactical changes nullify it, yet your players will miss one on ones every single time. Strikers getting 6.4s or lower every game is abject, seemingly for no reason, as they get chances, but can't put away routine finishes, despite having 18-19 finishing. And if you miraculously hold out against the one on one over the top ball nonsense, the opposition will score a screamer against you. This season, 10 games in and I've seen such renowned long shot specialists as Kyle Walker, Joe Gomes, Abdoulaye Doucoure and Stefano Sensi score thunderbastards into the top corner. Yet Harry Kane can't score from 5 yards with just the keeper to beat. 

But at the end of the day, buy the game and play it how you want. But when Danny Welbeck and Adam Lallana score a hat-trick against you, you'll be very, very sorry.

- Defenders keep avoiding the strikers when they come into the penalty box. They litteraly avoid them, its like they are scared of the strikers.
- Attackers miss every fucking opportunity given, crosses, 1 vs 1, they miss everything.

- You can have 60% of posession and shoot 30 TIMES, that the opposite team will shoot 4 times and they will win.
I had several games in the lower leagues of english football where I was winning 2-0, 3-0, even 4-0 with 15 shots or more and they have 6 shots and score them all. I have tried changing formations, every tactic out there... Nothing, even on the BETA. The funny thing is I am sure they will sell next years improvement thanks to the shit match engine they have now. They will say "IMPROVED MATCH ENGINE"... sad

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
I have been playing this game since the days I had no pubic hair. It was called a bit different back then, posing the -title- winning Championship Manager crown. An era where you just read text about your imaginary joga bonito and had some sheer fun cheering at flashing psychedelic text.

Those days are long gone. From Championship, we have switched to just... Football. Do not get me wrong, I'm not another one of those nostalgicphiles, quite the opposite. However, it just incomprehensible that the game is going from bad to worse. DLC level additions year after year, and an ever declining match engine that has just led to today's broken game. We never asked our addiction to follow RTX tech level advancements. All we asked -and to this day, still do- is that what you try to 'design' on a tactics board, is followed to a logical extent on the pitch. Instead of aiming to fix the ice skating phenomena of the motion -wtf is- captured, focus on getting the basics right. The game should all be AI, seamlessly working algorithms, multi million calculations per second that would resurrect ENIAC out of its grave. I fail to comprehend how the match engine is declining instead of improving over the past few months/years. With all due respect to those hard working individuals (I'm sure there's plenty of those) but is the level of staff working in SI declining? From a CX perspective, you consistently present a malfunctioning product, with DLC level additions, at a premium Epsilon Alpha (wink wink) price. Hand in heart, you should take a sabbatical year from production, fix the basics of a functional match engine, and release the next version on September 1st 2021. Yep, the year is not a typo. Riding that early season hype wave may even help you recover the lost year of revenue.

 I just came across a post from 2010 where a player was complaining about a 3% cross completion ratio. Guess what, a decade later, players with crossing 15+ finish the game with 10-15%. Your team's players crosses will always be stopped by those heroic opposition fullbacks, despite having galloped past them like Usain Bolt against schoolboys. On the opposite end of the pitch, those schoolboys always get their revenge with a staggering 80%+ cross completion ratio! 

Goal conversion is just like VAR in England. An absolute joke. One-on-ones are still not fixed since...October XX (where XX add the year of your liking). Lukaku level strikers (love or hate), finish two seasons with 8% conversion. Lautaro loves bruising the shins of centre halves by fiercely kicking the s*** out of them (with the ball, no red card material here you naughty minds).

Goalkeeper distribution is still as good as CM 00/01. Imaginary. "Ederson with the quick release" remains fiction.

Anyway, I could go on and on and on... But truth is, I'm tired. Tired like you start a Champions League final in June with 58% condition... The match engine is just like a hamstring. They think it's healthy and gets torn again. Don't force us to retire, get us a good head of sports science to restore our faith in the parallel universe that we all loved over the years...

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
Pure random junk simulator, it's just a rather bad game. You can call it the 'cheating engine'. I'm a long time player, this time they made a random result game. You can be the best manager, have the best team with the best morale, still losing with the weakest team at home. You can be first after midseason and with morale top get a streak of bad results ruining your whole season. So, if you don't like to cheat, you will collect bad results at home against weak teams; then you will eventually win again away against good teams. It's just frustrating, instead of improving it Sports Interactive worsened it. Beautiful presentation, broken game (it's clearly designed badly); before or later it will cheat, that's it. An insult to Sigames customers. Just try to exploit the engine and be happy about it, otherwise it will frustrate you. How you do it? It's simple, just remove forwards and add wingers, because the somewhat laughable match engine expect it; it's strong against forwards and weak against wingers, so don't dream about your tactic, the one that it works is the one that it's going to exploit the match engine. It's not about having the best team with a coherent tactic, but having a good team playing an exploiting tactic. Unhappy to have spent so much money for this year iteration. It must be said that it is become an elephant. It's slow in day by day progression (it can take 20 to 30 minutes for a virtual week, so you are going to waste more time than in the past) and the GUI graphics is fat, too much rich and boring like the match engine; luckily, I've been able to find an excellent skin that at least add spices to that depressive 'dull english art with added punk', it's called Heffem and it's made by Krysler, a bold artist; unfortunately it doesn't support very large fonts, well... I'll adapt to it; it's sacrifices a bit of readability (stretched fonts) but it adds coolness, a colorful and complete environment with a great match day graphics. So, all in all, shame on the (cheap) designers/coders responsible of all of this. The game system needs to be overhauled, or better... remade, certainly shrinked.
On the pros must cite the inclusion of new roles in the match engine that add a bit of variety (not much, some roles aren't that much diversified) and the inclusion of analysts for scouting. Also, the transfer market to me looks better than before. Scouting, as a whole, looks less intuitive and streamlined. Sigames put a patch on micromanagement, that aspect can be (almost) serenely offloaded to staff members. 3D match engine graphics are better than before (that's what sold me, unfortunately I didn't knew about the newly featured 'random junk engine').

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
The match engine is not good. The referees and their obsession for yellow cards and penalties, the 1v1s, your inside forwards and wingers shooting from impossible angles, your players missing from 4 yards out constantly.... This is just a selection of the annoying nonsense in FM20's match engine. I cannot believe how significantly it has regressed from FM19. Until it is improved, I cannot recommend this game even though I'll probably continue playing cause I'm just a sucker for pain and frustration.

EDIT: Think It's time to change the review and recommend the game because after all the updates, my experience of the match engine is at least on par with FM19, if not better. I have hope now that my players could score a 1v1, wingers shooting from impossible angles has been fixed, 4 yard misses happen but not that frequently and the refs are not as obsessed with setting yellow card given records every game.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
Everything apart from the matches is superb, best FM ever. 

The match engine is fundamentally broken - too easy to split a defence open with a long ball resulting in a one-on-one, so SI nerfed the conversion rates of one-on-one chances to keep scorelines acceptable. The result however, is that your world class  striker misses 2-5 easy chances every game. 

Wingers do not square the ball for strikers, instead preferring to shoot from obscenely acute angles rather than play the ball across the box. 

Half the crowd is a repeated man in an orange jumper. This may sound minor but it's really immersion breaking once you notice it. You can be a team that plays in blue, and yet over 50% of the crowd are dressed in orange. It diminishes the match experience and detracts from the game as a whole.

It's crap like this, broken for 2 months now, I've bought every game in this series since the year 2000, I pre-order every year (literally the only game I will do so with) and said I'll continue to do so until I get burned. Well, SI Games, you've broken me at last. The 'Bugs' section of your forum is littered with these issues that are "under review", well you can consider my purchase of FM 2021 in the same category.

Edit: I played a bunch more because apparently I'm a masochist. The match engine is total cack and has regressed massively since FM 2017. Don't waste your money - take up a more enjoyable pastime such as jamming needles in your eyes, you'll thank me for it.

title: Football Manager 2020
review: First of all, i love the game as it is one of the best games i have ever played. I breathe and speak football 24/7 and it has always been a distant dream of mine to become a professional manager at some point.  As that dream is a little unrealistic, FM has always been a good replacement. I have been playing this game since 2014 and has since then played every edition of the game for more hours than i probably should. But the game is just too good. Not only incredibly fun, but also the most realistic football game on the market and the fact that SEGA and everyone participating in making this game manages to improve it every year and for every edition they release is simply incredible! title: Football Manager 2020
review:
First review I've ever left, but feel I need to add a warning here. As of 13 January 2020, the match engine is fundamentally broken - one on ones and headers are almost impossible to score regardless of the level. You'll spend hours trying to figure out a way to convert chances, thinking it's your tactic that's the problem, but the match engine so far this year is just bugged. Look on reddit etc and you'll see hundreds of posts with the same issue.

My advice is to not buy this game until they've fixed it - it's a joke that it still hasn't been addressed by now and SI is another company who are happy to release an unfinished, untested product and screw over their loyal customers. They hardly make any changes every year - so why they can't devote more time to QA before release is just negligent. FM has become a cash cow to SEGA in much the same way FIFA is for EA.

Notice how you can no longer buy any of the previous years editions of FM which are balanced and just require an updated database to bring up to date. SI and Sega are pulling a fast one.

Recommendation: Buy the game in March or April when it's fixed and is 50% of the price.

Pros:
Dev Center.
New analysis tools.
New staff roles.

Cons: 
Broken & Unrealistic Match Engine.
Very few changes notable from last year.

review: The Football Manager franchise has been by far the class of the genre.  FM 2020 continues on the that tradition with new football team interactions, strategies and improved graphics. title: Football Manager 2020
review:
Been a long-time player since the very first version in 1995. Many good changes over the years but the development team was complacent this year. I can live with fewer changes but the broken match engine is unbearable. Strikers can't score and you regularly fire 40 shots to maybe convert one or two.
If the franchise overhauled the match engine, this would again be one of the very best sports strategy games out there.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
I really want to give this game a positive review but unfortunately there are just too many problems with the match engine that take away from the "glossy" improvements elsewhere. Sure. There are positives:

Board Vision and the fact that clubs are now being picky over who they invite to interviews is both realistic and frustrating (lets be honest, how many Conference National managers get jobs at higher levels unless they get their team promoted - Christ.......even Grimsby just appointed Ian Holloway rather than take a risk on a proven manager such as Dodswell at Havant)

Youth Development side of things is good and a real improvement as all fans want to see their clubs develop their youth players.

Right........moan time: Firstly......I want to say that I have seen over 1500 football matches live (mainly PL and Championship but also many games in the Conference National and South) so in terms of having seen football I have about 150,000 hours of the damn game.

MATCH ENGINE. Real ife vs FM20

Real life:

I took some notes from the last 10 live games I saw:

Only  7 one on ones in ten games - 4 scored
107 corners - 4 goals from them
Only twice did defenders get caught woefully out of position and outpaced by a striker
In all ten games - NO goals from long shots

In the FM20 match engine:

About 10 one on ones a game - but with about a 10% conversion rate (if you're lucky) - too many one on ones by a long score but this is counteracted by the fact that no-one ever scores from them.

Attackers whilst on the ball still easily outpace a retreating defender. This is utterly ridiculous as I've only ever seen top class players with rapid pace able to do this. 

Defenders never "drop". E.g. Even though a defender is 31 and had 300 games under his belt, he'll still allow a striker to run through the middle cos he's too busy marking someone else. Also, it doesn't matter what height defensive line you play as they'll always allow strikers to ghost past them for the inevitable missed one on one.

Players just don't tackle. I mean. I play with a "Get Stuck In" mentality and even target some of their players further (yeah........nice I know) but the team waltz around the pitch like they're auditioning for Swan Lake.

Shouts: Some work, some never work.......although there is probably more variation in what works from FM19. Concentrate and tighten up always cause utter confusion in the ranks even though you've justifiably given the instruction on 85 minutes when you're 2-1 up away from home. But they all get frustrated like they're six year olds who all want to score in a game down the park. 

Overall. I think a lot of the improvements to the "glossy" side of the game are good. But it does seem like SI have gone and done a Disney Star Wars......

"Look......its so bright, flashy with all these special effects........its Football Manager - you've got to like it". Even though the soul of the game has been completely ignored.

Hoping this gets addressed in a patch but am worried that SI are now more interested in profit than caring for this game. Hoped to be proved wrong.

I'm going back to FM19 and hoping they fix this mess but I'm not hopeful.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
I have been playing FM since FM12 and have loved most of the games with 2 or 3 having 1000+ hours played. 91 hours in i am beginning to lose patience with this game for 1 reason which i think is a pretty big deal:

The superhuman ability of goalkeepers... i am consistently getting 3-4 clear cut changes along with 2-3 half chances per game an coming away with 0-0 and 1-1 draws. in fact in my last game i had 6 clear-cut chances and 2 half chances and lost the game 2-0...How are lacazaette and aubayang not scoring goals...its beyond frustrating. I have a a game in which i had 10 clear cut chances (the most i have ever seen) and won 1-0 what a joke...how is only one goal being scored.

This is beyond my control as a manager i am delighted with the chances being created i can do no more and its agony watching chance after chance go by...what am i doing wrong????!

Is anyone else expericing this?

this is the first time i have not recommended a FM game i have given up unless there is something i can do to improve the scoring rate.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
The last time I played this game was nearly five years ago. Therefore comparisons I made may not be appropriate for you.  

Tactics and its customisations are pretty ok. (Of course during the game you shouldn't change your tactic too many times)

Players attack skills or defence skills may go wrong often. 3D match vision seems to be ok, but it should be improved. (come on it's 2020, you can do better)

I'm a bit shocked when I see one on one situations. Mostly goalkeeper is the winner side but believe me if you play it you will agree with me.

FFP is the sword of Democles (:

VAR decisions might give a heart attack (:

If you want to spend your time, give a chance.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
- Terrible Match engine where 1v1 always end up with a save or a miss. Also when a player runs after a ball it takes 10 minutes for them to control it which usually means they lose possession

- Man marking does absolutely nothing. Tried it many times.

- Shouts do nothing as well. It's just a pointless tab

- Don't know if anyone else gets this but you always end up drawing against the hardest team in a cup, Multiple times

- Proof of scripting with drawing harder teams in cups and the occasional 3D match engine errors

- The players themselves are just dumb and don't do what they are suppose to do accordingly for example booting the ball out when there is space. Shooting that goes miles off target. Not crossing the ball when there is a player unmarked and could potentially score

- Every team no matter what even if play the instructions " Pass into space " Or short passing only " They will still long balls over the defence or fail to vise versa. And quite a few goals have come through annoying over head long balls

The only thing the game developers did to this game was improve the layout then brag about it like it was something refreshing when it really isn't. It's terrible, They need to listen to what everyone else has been saying in the negative reviews and improve the match engine.

review:
As always, football manager is fun. They've continued making the experience outside of matches even better.

I do feel the match engine took a step backwards in this iteration however.
It seems a good majority of chances is the same thing.
Player X hits a perfect pass over the defending backline. Player Y misses easy 1on1 opportunity with the GK that follows. This happens two or three times every game and feels a bit unrealistic.
This is my only concrete example, but overall it doesn't feel as sharp as older versions.

Overall it's still a good game however.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
I'm only about half a season in but so far it's more frustrating than anything.

I've given up trying to play good football because creating 5-10 clear cut chances a game doesn't seem to matter because you'll only score like 5% of the time from them. I've had a ton more success after telling my team to shoot from long range all the time. How messed up is it that long range pot shots have a better rate of success than clear cut chances?

Another issue is that strength and pace are still the be-all-end-all of attributes. There's no place in the game for intelligent players who don't rely on athleticism. For example, Firmino scored 3 goals in 15 games for me, but Origi who is only superior in the physical attributes is averaging a goal per game. Origi is playing like the world class forward Firmino should be just because he's fast and strong.

I'm gonna shelve this for a while in the hopes that the match engine gets some serious patches.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
An avid player of football manager franchise since 2012 and have bought each game every year. This is the first one that has caused me so much frustration. Opposition goalkeepers seem to be superhuman, corners and free kicks are broken, heading from anywhere will very rarely go in. Only opportunity to score is via a ball over the top which when playing tiki taka is frustrating, especially when world class strikers miss at least 90% of all these chances. Match engine broken, and spoiling an otherwise in depth and fantastic game.

Please fix

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
I tried. I tried to like this game, as much as I have the other entries in the series from years past. After two updates and 3 seasons in the game, it's fair to say the problems really are in the match engine. This is my latest match report:

[table]
[tr]
[th]Team[/th]
[th]Liverpool[/th]
[th]Norwich[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[th]Shots[/th]
[th]29[/th]
[th]6[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[th]Shots on Target[/th]
[th]13[/th]
[th]2[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[th]Possession[/th]
[th]54%[/th]
[th]46%[/th]
[/tr]

Guess my final score? Liverpool (my team) lost 0-1 to Norwich. And this with me fielding Alisson, TAA, Ruben Dias, Van Dijk, F.Luis, Mane, Havertz, Sancho, Firmino etc

Problems with ME that I notice:
- One over the top through ball from your opponent and he's clean through, scoring his one-on-one chance.
- Speaking of one-on-one chances, forget about it. You'll never score any. While your opponents score from just 1. 
- Don't even bother spending on forwards because they'll never score anyway. So I decided to spend on wingers, but they too just shoot into the side netting from ridiculous angles.
- Dribbling is OP, my full-backs dribble all the way from their own halves, get into a very good crossing or cut-back position with an unmarked striker waiting in the box and guess what, they choose to shoot into the side netting.

Not gonna play this frustrating game anymore. I'm okay with losing in FM, but not through unrealistic scenarios that seem to be scripted to put the players at a disadvantage.

title: Football Manager 2020
review: This is a downgrade over FM19 and previous versions. Irrespective with whether you play with ultra attacking or ultra defensive tactic, the opposition will have atleast 30 attempts. On the contrary, my team (which has several world class players) struggle to put away 2 shots on very attacking mode when chasing a game in second half while opposition, on ultra defensive approach, is still able to have multiple attempts. Hitting woodwork, missing out on one-on-one with goalkeepers continuously and scoring unbelievable goals (from the top of head of defenders or 30 yard screamers) is as annoying as it gets. Becomes unplayable and boring after a point in time because change in tactics just doesnt yield anything and you are left with no choice but stop playing the game, Undoes all other upgrades made  in the game. would not recommend it to others till the time the developers come out with significant fixes to the match engine.

Top strikers cant score and miss a stupid amount of one on one chances. You will often find your team is 2 or 3 on 1 inside the 18 yard box and rather than square the ball for an easy goal your player will blast wide or straight at the keeper and there doesnt seem to be any defence against a long through ball which destroy you every time. I wont even go into how retarded the defending is on this years game but they literally run around in circles soumetimes.

Dont bother buying it just stick to 19.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
There's still a significant issue with the finishing. It's supposed to have been fixed by a patch, but it simply hasn't been. I'm averaging 23 shots per game (perhaps too high), but only 7 on target (far too low a percentage) and many of those are weak efforts which look more like passes, straight at the keeper. Consequently I'm struggling to score goals. Ridiculous.

The problem even extends to penalties - my main taker (PEN: 17) has taken seven so far and scored ONE of them!

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
Positive review turned negative:

I took a 2 week break and came back and some of the few positive changes in the early patches are gone. Wow SI, wow.

WORST MATCH ENGINE EVER.

Current:
Match engine is having some major game killing issues and they seem to be having a problem getting it sorted out. I don't remember a FM release being this wacked out gameplay wise on full release, I'm not feeling confident as several of the issues they have been aware of and after several huge updates (one of them nearly a gig worth) these issues aren't fixed.

Inside Forwards and Raumdeuters will not shoot at the goal with their dominate foot, nor will they drive at goal like they should.
Everyone should be able to picture the ubiquitous Salah (of Liverpool) goal, where he drives into the box from the right and curls a shot with his left foot.

Will not happen once in FM 2020. He gets in the box 1v1 and is not blocked by the defender, but he mostly passes the ball outside the box away from goal, and not to someone with a chance to shoot. 

Or he turns and drives to the end line or corner of the post and tries to shoot with his weaker foot through the post.

This is being reported for other players and teams. They have to have seen these reports, PKMs have been uploaded, but here's the thing SI

ALL YOU HAVE TO DO IS FIRE UP A GAME YOURSELF AND TRY TO GET THE MOST SINGLE MINDED SHOOTING INSIDE FORWARD IN FOOTBALL TO TRY TO SHOOT WITH HIS LEFT FOOT FROM THE RIGHT.

And you will see it is broken.

They did fix the fact that no player would ever play a long through ball through the center or over the center.

Also you have to play with your defense on narrow defending, but the space is still far too wide when out of possession. You could slide a semi trailer between CBs sideways when set to narrow. I know they spread out often when in possession, but not out of possession.

The behavior of the wing backs is not much better, they refuse to cross until they are at the endline, or they pass backwards before then. 

Cross from deep
Cross early
Cross more often

These mean nothing in FM 2020.

I would wait and watch these reviews and check the posts on the Match Engine Bugs thread on Sports Interactive Forums, you can view them without signing up.


Early review:

THEY FIXED THE ANNOYING REPETITIVE JOKE THAT WAS WINGERS AND FULLBACKS SMASHING CROSSES INTO THE DEFENDERS RIGHT IN FRONT OF THEM OVER AND OVER AND OVER.

UPDATE UPDATE!!!! Now they have even removed the above! ALL WIDE PLAYERS are back to smashing it into the nearest defender.

title: Football Manager 2020
review: Admittedly I'm running at a bit of a deficit since while I was a football player, I never really followed professional football (so a lot of the high level tactics are unknown to me, for example). Despite that, this game series has to be the most baffling I've ever played--In like 15 years of playing videogames I have to say this is the only one that I seem to get worse at with time. Even after consuming a ton of online written/video guides I just can't seem to get a hang of it, so I suppose there is a possibility of user error here. There are a slew of numbers and an appearance of depth but it's extremely hard to me to see how you'd isolate out how one thing effects another...for example, did the changes in training actually help? Are slightly higher stats on my assistant manager actually doing anything? I could go on and on but you get my point. Also, as others have pointed out, the match engine seems super janky and random, and my team's excellent form would randomly crumble without any indication as to why. All in all if you're a football fan trying to expose yourself more to the football world I think it's a fine purchase, but evaluating it purely as a simulation game I don't think it holds up.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
It's perhaps a great game if what you mostly do is hit the continue button, but if you are any kind of micromanager the number of bugs make it fairly annoying to try to do anything.

Spain and Germany has this B club system that I started bug reporting on in something like 2014 and with the latest FM20 has made the B clubs even worse, what was supposed to be "a great new feature" instead just take all the brokeness of B clubs and mangle it into the senior club, resulting in problems with hiring staff or asking for more coaches (result in the Senior team getting more coaches, so great a unlimited coach exploit) or problems with Sensior players not being able to play for the B team, because the game flags the senior players as unregistered, most of the time the interface to select players to play on the B team don't come up and when it finally does the interface menu is broken and is the menu for unselecting B players for the B team, not for selecting Senior players, so it has no effect. If you manually select a player to play for the B team, the game does this unregistered check and don't allow the player to play, you have to use the broken menu, in the part that is supposed to be the already selected players to play and double tell that they can play, this apparently get around the unregistered problem. Unfortunately something prevents the selection inbox item from showing up most of the time, so it's really hard using the B team to get someone back after injury.

England don't have B clubs, so at least I hope that is working better, but then we have a million other bugs, that has been reported year after year that SI just don't care about fixing.

Then there is things like PSG is a better club than Barca and Real Madrid, so all the good players in the world want to play for PSG and PSG win bidding wars against the big clubs, but at the same time the frenche league is flagged as being not as good, so all those world class players isn't as good as if they played in Spain/England, resulting in PSG not being able to compete in Champions Cup.

Harry Kane and Christian Eriksen both went to PSG on lower, even after my Barca team offered higher wages, I think it was 100K/week more than what they accepted from PSG.

When I paid 209m for Kylian, I get told he is improving playing on our team because he is playing football at a higher level than what he got at PSG. (Not sure if that is fair to the French league, but that is how the in game simulation see's things.)

So half my team is wanted by PSG and want to leave to play at a bigger club, but if I buy PSG players I'm apparently the stronger club.

Oh and the "played" hours is pretty much completely fake, it takes forever to start the game due to the mostly unskipable stupid copyright screens at the beginning and load times, so for every 1 hour played, I get 23 hours of the game idling, until I return the next real world day to play again.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
First of all, appreciated all the new features the game added this year. Regardless if these new features are  worthy to dig in or not, I can feel the effort you guys put in. The training part becomes more detailed. The Tactics are well explained and easy to configure. The transfer part becomes a little bit more realistic.

But I would NOT recommend FM2020. 

Here is why:
Have played so many gens of FM. I don't understand why the Devs make the GK so godly this year, almost unbeatable. Tell me when do you see a GK save 99% of  1 vs 1 situation in a match and how do you feel after seeing that happens in every single game you play? Shitty. First time in my life, I feel shitty when I play FM. 
Why do you do that to the players?
My assumption is that the tactics in 2020 are too strong/too easy which allow players to create way too many chances in a single match. In order to make the game look not too easy, they have to stop you score that much. So their answer to this is to make the GK op instead of making the game more "realistic".
I've read many players have the same complains in the comment. So hope the devs can hear us and make some patch/update to fix this soon.
I know I am being criticism here just because I love FM and hope it becomes better every year.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
Could be a great game, however I've encountered so many issues.

1) EVERY opposition attack they look like scoring. It doesn't seem to matter what my tactics are or system is etc they always get a free shot at goal.
2) Centre backs that sweep out to the touchline ALWAYS backheel the ball to the nearest striker.
3) My team could have 10 CLEAR CUT 1v1 chances in a game and not score. The opposition will always score with their first.
4) Players getting booked/sent off after 1 or 2 fouls in the game. Opposition get about 15-20 before cards come out.
5) Sleeping goalkeepers. They let the ball roll to them instead of going to collect, meaning having to make an unnecessary save or conceding a goal.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
Slightly better than last years in part. Overall based on hours played I am obviously OK with this game but I do have a number of annoyances which come up alot with the hundreds of hours I play. 
Can be a bit annoying with the change of how responsibilities work, feels like they added more granularity but also took some previous away. (I.e. telling U21 and U18 to not use same tactics as first team is not obvious?) 
Does not always give the opportunity to include board promises when doing contract extensions.
I like the new team selection suggestion mail from your assistant which highlights things like training performance and promises which helps. 
I like the mentoring groups. 
Very over priced compared to past few years considering only incremental updates to game and DB

I ideally wish they corrected / improved the following: 
- Allow you to multi select to give praise/ critiicism to players for training effort
- more player talk options as at times they only give outcomes that will only result with an unhappy player
- Board overriding buying and selling amounts to block transfers , i.e. they dont want you to sell for a rubbish player to get anything you can (and they value the player at 50% more - which no-one will ever pay) - at the same time if you leave the club to auto recruit players they will pay ridicuilious amounts to buy (and wages to go with it). 
- game needs more NFT turning - can be sluggsh during matches (and I am doing 2D overview so not huge graphic rendering required). My machine is auto spec'd for high performance. 
- Like last year the in game shouts need some work. 'Get Creative' or 'Demand more' seem to be the only ones that result in a positive outcome ('Praise' only works if your smashing the other team and its mid 2nd half onwards). All others  have a negative outcome - like 'Encourage' - wtf does encouragement have a negative impact (at any point in the game from what ive tried). 
- Email that tells you players picked up positive and negative personality traits from their mentoring groups - but not which those are (so you can look at have them in a group that focuses on removal of those negative ones).  
- I liked before where I wasnt running U21 and U18 teams, but could easily setup friendly games for them via my main schedules calendar, but thats not present (I gather I need to be fully managing those teams before I can). 
- You join a new club with an existing roster and its like you just bought the team in terms of their team chemistry for on field partnerships. Likewise if I buy two players who played together last year or more into my club - they have no strong partnership - like strangers. 
- some players with low work rate or weak strength, no matter how many months you put them on individual programs to correct those, some never get better. Any player hitting the gym or doing endurance work as a pro althelete will improve (im not talking getting someone to 20 in each, im talking going from a 5 anything higher than a 5. Specifically players like 50 mil + wingers). 
- As a manager, id still love the ability to be able to use my career earnings to go and buy a team in lower leagues and build them up as an owner manager. (or keep working say in Prem league and hire someone else to manage my club). Owning a club and be the manager would allow you to avoid all the dumb board decisions and it could happen in real life. (Just look at Salford FC). 

There is lots more, but if this was my first FM game id be pretty happy.

review:
Game is broken, i have to save quickly after every match so that it does not crash after a surprising result (unlikely win or draw). I have a mac and updated to the newest version and it crashes all the time to the point where the game is unplayable. This evening i might have even lost a save game because it crashed and when i tried restarting it says saved game not found. Please advise on what to do and if possible i want to request a refund. i will delete the whole game as it is fundamentally broken. i put so many hours into a save for it to break on me.

the game is simply not ready for market if it is this unstable

Would suggest reading our troubleshooting FAQ guides here - https://community.sigames.com/faq/football-manager-2020/239_technical-support/

Failing that you can contact help@sega.co.uk for further support. Thanks.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
The decisions of players during a game are repetitive and not logical, everyone wants to dribble all the way and take a shot from any angle no matter what game plan you have. In all my hours playing this i have not seen a single goal where a player can pass to another for a tap in even if they are free. your attackers will miss around 90 percent of 1v1s no matter what their stats are.
 Your defence will always allow through balls and give away 1v1s for opposition no matter how deep and back you play them, there is no such thing as offside trap. the players look like headless chickens that run after a ball even when you ask not to press. 

as bad a the Ai was in previous games, it has actually  gone backwards from there to a point where the game is just un enjoyable. i sit there re-setting the game from a previous load for the first time since FM 2007 because my Bipolar team will play completely different every time. its like gambling at slots. no strategy works. you can beat the strongest teams in the game then get hammered by 20th place team 5 - 0. players sometimes forget that they are playing a game and take a stroll on the pitch when the ball is next to them. 

this game is ridiculous and every year my hopes go up that they may improve the AI on match day, yet all they do is change a colour or 2 and add a new shitty tab or 2 which honestly dont even matter if the core of the game isnt good. i mean if you kept last years, even thought it was also bad, it would have been better than this one. it is upsetting knowing what could have been a potentially fantastic game has failed because of lazy developers that have done jack shit in the past 5 years. the AI has not changed, and again, if anything it has regressed. great work you turds!

If you would like to play a good game play football manager 2007 or 2008. sadly there is no 3d Engine on it but the AI and excitement that you could get out of it was much much more satisfying.

review: I have been playing fm since 2009, yet this years release ( last year was dissapointing too ) really is unplayable, so many bugs in the game and not even mentioning ME, where you as a manager have almost no control of how the team plays, because the players keep doing stupid things (1v1, long balls to the sides for no reason, defenders not reacting sometimes at all etc.). I really regret buying this game, even though the signs were bad this year. SI really doesn't give a damn about it's long time customers, the forums have been littered with complaints about the ME, yet they don't do anything. This game probably be playable around march, but I didn't pay 50$ to have a shitty beta game UNTIL MARCH. I feel robbed of my money, the game is just unplayable and unsatisfying as hell. I'm done with FM, FM 19 was already problematic and this year really is insane. DONT BUY THIS PRODUCT, CHECK THE FORUMS EVERYBODY IS COMPLAINING ABOUT THIS BROKEN PRODUCT, YET THEY MAKE EXCUSES THE WHOLE TIME.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
I've felt that these games have been decreasing in quality rapidly over recent years. The last couple of FM games that I've played, the match engine just hasn't played realistically and there was always a disconnect between the tactics being implemented and the game that plays out on the pitch. So, when a friend told me that FM 2020 was amazing and way better than previous versions, I guess I just wanted to believe it too badly and I stumped up the cash for this season's offering. Sadly, I have to say that I feel this latest game is even poorer than it's predecessors. 

I know that a lot of people are now sick of the rudimentary 3D graphics of the match simulations in Football Manager, but I'm honestly not too bothered about that. I played Championship Manager when it was just text commentary and subsequently the 2D pitch and I had a blast with those games. My sole issue is the match engine and how the matches play out. Now, I can only imagine how difficult it must be to have a game with thousands of different teams in different leagues and different countries, where any given game played should offer a fairly realistic simulation experience. I certainly wouldn't know where to start creating something that complex. Given the complexity in creating this kind of accurate simulation that evolves alongside the modern game, I do expect a certain amount of rough edges and anomalous occurrences, which have always been present throughout the series. However, watching the matches in FM 2020 does not feel like watching a real football match. The way that the games flow and the strange occurrences that play out on field makes for quite a confusing and frankly boring experience. Many others have identified some of the recurring issues in the match engine, but the ones that I'm most affected by (constantly) are:
- Too many goals from long shots
- Too many chances in the penalty box being missed/saved when the attackers' stats would suggest that a goal is a very likely outcome
- Wide players with good crossing and vision stats on the ball with multiple options in the box and either no cross being attempted or the cross gets blasted into a nearby defender's shins.
- Players not taking obvious options e.g. several open team mates in passing range, but knock the ball out for a corner instead.
- Team instructions that seem to get ignored e.g. defend wide, but all of the defence is constantly clumped together in the box.

I could go on, but it seems pointless to enumerate the issues that have already been flagged dozens of times by others. What appears to be happening is that the game is trying to create an accurate simulation in terms of outcome (scorelines) whilst not being too concerned what happens on the pitch to reach that conclusion. I can accept that being an important part of the simulation experience. However, what I am witnessing within the matches themselves makes it too difficult for me to diagnose what I actually need to do to improve my tactics etc. What plays out on the field seems so disconnected from the tactics that I have selected that it often feels like a process of trial and error to find a tactic that the game approves of and then I'm left scratching my head wondering what the underlying reason for that is. Rather than seeing my team fail and being able to tell from the gameplay that my team are playing too narrow or too high up the field and that it's obviously creating vulnerabilities, my team can actually appear to play quite well, but consistently fall victim to "bad luck" instances. Ultimately, I don't feel like I have as much control as I'd like and it's just not fun to be essentially trying to guess what the game is thinking in order to succeed.

The only other thing maybe worth mentioning is that the set piece routines feel like they could be improved. For attacking corners, it feels like my players just ignore my instructions. For defending corners, I feel as though every substitution or change in lineup means that I have to re-assess the corner routine and make sure that I haven't now got a player that's 5 feet tall trying to mark the opposition's main goal scoring threat. I'm honestly not sure how best to overhaul this, but it's a part of the game that I find really tedious.

I fear that nothing will change as long as football management sims are a monopoly. There's probably no reason to improve the game if nobody else can produce a superior product and the majority of customers are content to play as Liverpool/City/PSG/Barca etc. and just brute force the game with high stat players. Any criticisms can just be waved away with "You must be tactically inept", so I guess that there's not much to be done. I only write this as an opportunity to vent my frustration of spending a lot of time trying to give this game a fair shake, in vain, but also so that other people thinking about buying the game will maybe read this and spare themselves the unnecessary expense and heartache.

I've been a player since ChampionshipManager 2003, and this is what its wrong with this game IT'S NOT FUN ANYMORE !
It's the same movie you liked but you watched 20 times and for the amount of money you'll spend, for the Tunnel Carpale you'll get and for damaging your eyes after hours and hours it's simply not worth it.

3) It's December and we're playing a League game at night and the temperature is 1°C, it's time to substitute a player, you go to tactics and send your player in...Without sending him to WARM UP first? You know what's gonna happen if after 20 secs that guy gets hit on the leg and he is totally cold? DO YOU THINK THAT IS REALISTIC?
4) Chairman's and Owners don't have their personalities, style, or goals. Do you think all the clubs that play a League are there to win something? Some owners just want to MAKE A PROFIT and that's it. They want to make profits through Sponsors, Tickets, Transfermarkt, TV etc. Some of them don't care about anything but money. 7) the price...for what? seriously for what, we have to download the game, the logos, fix the colours of the competitions, the kits (one by one), the facepack, the colours of the Brazilian clubs, WTF ???!!! if this game is what it is, it's mostly thanks to the ppl that create all the features to make this garbage fun
8) the "3D" I mean go to Youtube and look for PC CALCIO 2001 and look at their 3d, that was made 20 years ago and looks better than FM20, I won't add any other comment about that. That should make everyone reflect (I personally never played 3d I don't care but it p***es me off when you talk about the "improvements" you make to that c**p every year
9) Transfer market with exchanges it's simply IMPOSSIBLE to make
10) the individual training does barely make improvements

I HOPE A NEW COMPETITOR WILL COME AROUND, SO YOU GUYS CAN CLOSE YOUR LEGAL MONEY COLLECTOR GAME AND BYE BYE, I'm asking a refund 

IT'S TIME TO CHANGE, THIS ISN'T POSSIBLE ANYMORE

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
Some of the new stuff such as the club vision and development centre are nice additions, but as has been said in countless reviews so far, the match engine is tedious at best. The number of one on ones missed or saved is what really ruins the game for me, the players trying to shoot from the byline or wingers shooting from a tight angle when there is someone in the centre free is just the cherry on the cake and I don't like cherries so it just compounds the misery for me.

The transfer system is as standard, a player you own is worth say 10mil, a club will offer 8 and said player will be upset that you reject the offer. A player another clubs owns is worth 10mil, they want 30mil and no ones bats an eyelash when you refuse to pay it.

The game feels like it is missing something, it feels pretty one dimensional now, it has a drop down box for the role when a club offers you a job, but you can only ever be a manager, it seems as though SI thought about putting things like head coaches and interim managers in, but decided not to, which is a shame as it could have been tied into the club vision quite nicely, with some clubs operating where you are the head coach and have little to no say in your TD or DOF appointments as well as the transfers, which does happen at some clubs.

I feel at some point SI will have to be bold at some point and offer the user a chance to be a reserve manager, academy manager or a director of football, as there is only so much they can do and rehash every year before it well and truly becomes stale, which if they continue down the path they have for the last few editions, could be in the near future.

But overall, it is not THAT far off, its needing some system tweaks, but like I said, at some point, SI will have to make a bold move

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
Don't buy at full price. No where near worth the big cost at this current moment. If you have FM19 stick with that with updated squads for the time being. This game is a mess. A month in and still so many issues. The match engine is the worst I've ever seen. Both performance wise with lag (even on 2D) and in game animations/player decisions/broken mechanics etc. The lack of patches is shocking from SI. We already have to wait several months into a new football season to play the game then when it drops they barely patch. Should be weekly patches on a game with so many problems. 

Considering it's a whole new title there are very few changes and ones there are were things that weren't really needed. £40 for this game is a joke. It's not worth half of that. Save your money for a sale.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
I felt I had to write this review despite my limited time playing the game since I have a major problem with it, that I want to warn people about before buying it.

My computer more than fits the requirement to run this game - it's not a very demanding game by any means. Yet I find that everything is laggish/sluggish, not just the match engine, but the menus too. It's like everything is running in slight slowmotion that throws you off.

I looked up potential solutions and noted that people had found that downloading custom skins could solve the problem - and it did for many people. Sadly not for me, though. And besides, you shouldn't have to rely on 3rd party items to solve something as basic as perfomance. 

Until the performance is fixed I cannot recommend this game. You most likely (?) wont run into this problem, but even if it's only a fraction of us it's unacceptable when the game costs 55 euros.

review:
