review: I wouldn't recommend this if you got last year's version. Very little improvements that don't justify paying for. The match engine is horrible and I hope SI fixes this. I've not seen a single 1v1 chance scored, whether it's my team or the opposition team. Most of the goals I've scored come from long range efforts, which is super unrealistic. Also, they've removed the ability to fine you player for performing badly. All in all, it's not a bad game, but it's not worth upgrading to if you have FM19. Genuinely wish I could get a refund on this.

title: Football Manager 2020
review: Brilliant as usual. Been playing since CM/FM since the mid 90`s and love the game, so i am a bit biased. The new Club vision and development centre parts of the game are fantastic editions to someone like me who likes to play a proper career( Start Unemployed, with no badges yet). The evolution of youth players and the use of an actual vision of what the Club want to do allows for more long term planning and even more immersion into the game. It always takes me many weeks to switch from the previous version of the game to the new one, because starting over( whilst i have 40 or more years of history in a current game) is hard to let go. But i was still intending to play FM2019 for a few more weeks yet (Trying to win the Bundesliga with Freiburg in 2055 after 6 years in the job and last season being pipped by Bayern Munchen on goal difference) but started a game in FM20 just to have a look at the new features and havent returned to the Black forest yet, 20 hours of gametime later, i wonder if i`ll ever return to see if we could get the Meisterschale. 10/10

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
The game interface has been made to be bulkier, at the expense of usability. For example, when adding new players during the Create New Club flow, you are only allowed to see 3 rows of players at a time...

Another example of poor UI design is the tactics selection. I am no longer able to cycle between all formations so I can choose the one I want. They are now locked behind a tactical style, and you have to pick one before you can see formations. 

Squad selection page is cluttered, and the mid match view is not intuitive in terms of being able to quickly see what the best sub options are for a particular player. You seem to have added multiple views but they each do a separate thing, which is not very efficient.

You had a great interface before that was more compact and easier to browse. Since this game is all about data, you shouldn't make fields, rows and columns larger, so that we have to scroll more for no reason. You are basically falling to the level of EA's Fifa games when you do this.

review:
OMG! I have nothing to say except perfect!
You will not regret with this price.

Graphics have upgraded so well as well as the players' movement. It became more realistic.

Although responsibilities and some other new features are slightly complicated, once it has been done, it is actually easier to manage the team.

Hope it helps!

One thing I want to ask SI is that how can I change the Graphics card to the NVIDIA one, it tells me that I'm using the Corel one.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
So far so goo in this beta. Just a couple of bugs/missing feature, but the game's a pleasure!

- yellow cropping moves every time it's resized in the 3D generation of Manager's portrait
- no copy/paste support from windows or password managers when logging on social media's profiles
- Windows Game Bar doesn't detect the game as running	
- Job Security tab hasn't a filter to show only available jobs
- sometimes when quit to main menu, the screen becomes pitch black and the only way out is terminating the game from task manager

title: Football Manager 2020
review: Match engine seems much better. A lot of first touch passes and uses of vision that I haven't seen in previous iterations. Regen faces were updated but to be honest they don't really look any more realistic than they did before... While this is a "filler" year in terms of headline features; the behind the scenes improvements are well worth the $45-$50.

title: Football Manager 2020
review:
I mean if you liked the last one you'll like this one. There are a couple of improvements but honestly, like FIFA you're paying for the updated scouting and teams etc. The engine seems improved and the small details in staff and youth management seems a bit better and easier to both streamline and go into detail which is great but I think most players will barely realize it.


I recommend this game because it is the best management game out there. Even if you're not a huge football fan you'd like this great simulation/management game. A keen interest and knowledge of real football of course helps though.

title: Football Manager 2020
review: every time i try to play a match the game crashes
developer_response:
Are you running on Mac OSX 10.11? If so we're aware of an issue of crashing during matches in the pre-release Beta and we're looking to address it as soon as we can. 

In the meantime you could try upgrading your Operating System (which is free on Macs) as shown here - https://support.apple.com/en-gb/HT201541

If you're not running on Mac/that operating, please contact help@sega.co.uk and they'll be able to offer further support. Thanks. 

EDIT - Just to confirm this issue has been fixed for Mac 10.11 in Hotfix 20.0.2 so please try again now.
